text: Paul admonishes the Corinthians to forgive the penitent offender so that

options.A: the offender may have peace of mind
options.B: it may be a lesson to other believers
options.D: the offender may not be overwhelmed by excessive sorrow

explanation:
Paul addresses the issue of forgiveness in2 Corinthians 2:7 (RSV):
"so you should rather turn to forgive and comfort him, or he may be overwhelmed by excessive sorrow."
Paul encourages the Corinthians to forgive a repentant sinner so that he does not fall into deep despair or excessive grief. Instead of condemning the offender further, they should offer comfort and restoration.

options.A: was loyal and dedicated to Moses
options.B: brought a good report from the land of Canaan
options.C: stood by Moses when the Israelites murmured against God
options.D: was a man in whom was the spirit

explanation:
God appointedJoshuato succeed Moses because he wasa man in whom was the spirit. This is stated inNumbers 27:18 (RSV):

text: What punishment did God give Solomon for his unwise policies?

options.A: Jeroboam was empowered by God to conquer him
options.B: He caused Rezon to demolish the high place which he built
options.C: He raised up Haded, the Edomite as an adversary against him
options.D: The kingdom was torn from him and given to his servant

explanation:
Due to Solomon's unwise policies, God declared that the kingdom would be taken away from him. However, out of respect for David, Solomon's father, this punishment was deferred until after Solomon's death. The kingdom was then divided, with ten tribes given to Jeroboam, one of Solomon's servants, and the remaining part (Judah) staying with Solomon's lineage.
(1 Kings 11:9–13)
